page.title: 06E.Horsley S. Farm statistics
page.content: There are 4 farms in the area of 100 acres or more. Place Farm - 300 acres, Dunley Hill Farm - 240 acres, Hillside Farm - 157 acres & Crocknorth Farm - 100 acres. 4 smaller farms make up a total area of approximately 880 acres. Most of the farmland (some 391 acres) is permanent or semi-permanent grass- land mainly used for store cattle, primarily Hereford/Friesian, Angus/ Friesian and Limosin/Friesian. Native woodland takes up some 90 acres, Place Farm has 30 acres (1/10th of its area) and Dunley Hill Farm 40 acres (1/16th). Hookwood Farm has nearly half of its 24 acres covered by woodland. Annual rainfall is low (26 inches) and the soil variable - chalk, sand and clay with flints which were once much used for building houses and barns in this area.
